item.title: Cozy Comforting Beef Stew for Cold Winter Nights
item.description: Warm up with this cozy beef stew, perfect for chilly nights! Made with tender beef, hearty vegetables, and aromatic herbs, it's a comforting dish that brings the family together. Ideal for weeknight dinners or special occasions. Save this recipe for your next gathering! | â±ï¸ Prep: 15min | Cook: 120min | Serves: 6 | #cat1761230594885 #Easyrecipe #recipe #cooking #foodie
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 120 minutes

â° Total Time: 135 minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 6

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 2 pounds beef chuck, cut into 1-inch cubes
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 large onion, chopped
  • 3 cloves garlic, minced
  • 4 carrots, sliced
  • 3 potatoes, diced
  • 2 cups beef broth
  • 1 cup red wine
  • 2 tablespoons tomato paste
  • 1 teaspoon dried thyme
  • 1 bay leaf
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Fresh parsley for garnish

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add beef cubes and brown on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
  2. Add chopped onion and minced garlic to the pot, cooking until the onion is translucent, about 3-4 minutes.
  3. Stir in carrots and potatoes, followed by beef broth, red wine, tomato paste, thyme, and bay leaf. Bring to a boil.
  4. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 1.5 to 2 hours, until the beef is tender and the flavors meld together.
  5. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Remove bay leaf before serving.
  6. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve hot.

item.description: Indulge in this decadent chocolate Yule log, perfect for festive celebrations! Save this recipe for your next celebration! | â±ï¸ Prep: 30min | Cook: 25min | Serves: 8 | #cat1761230294638 #Mediumrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 30 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 25 minutes

â° Total Time: 55 minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 8

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Medium

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 4 large eggs, separated
  • 1 cup granulated sugar
  • 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
  • 1/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 cup heavy cream
  • 2 tablespoons powdered sugar
  • 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract for cream
  • Chocolate shavings for garnish

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C) and line a 15x10-inch jelly roll pan with parchment paper.
  2. In a large bowl, beat the egg yolks and granulated sugar until thick and pale, about 5 minutes. Stir in the flour, cocoa powder, and salt until just combined.
  3. In another bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form. Gently fold the egg whites into the chocolate mixture until no white streaks remain.
  4. Spread the batter evenly in the prepared pan and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the cake springs back when lightly touched.
  5. Once baked, remove from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes. Invert the cake onto a clean kitchen towel dusted with powdered sugar. Peel off the parchment paper and roll the cake up with the towel. Let it cool completely.
  6. For the filling, whip the heavy cream with powdered sugar and vanilla extract until soft peaks form. Unroll the cooled cake, spread the cream filling evenly, and re-roll the cake without the towel. Chill for at least 1 hour before serving.

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 lb ground beef, cooked and seasoned
  • 1 can biscuit dough

  • 1 tbsp garlic powder

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 375Â°F (190Â°C).
  2. In a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until browned, seasoning with salt and pepper to taste.
  3. Remove from heat and stir in the garlic powder and shredded cheddar cheese until well combined.
